meanings.definition: The act of rejecting or disowning something.
meanings.sent1: Her repudiation of the gift hurt his feelings.
meanings.sent2: The company's repudiation of the faulty product was necessary.
meanings.sent3: The repudiation of the invitation led to some awkwardness.
meanings.sent4: His repudiation of the traditional values shocked his family.
meanings.sent5: The repudiation of the treaty caused a diplomatic crisis.

meanings.definition: A denial or refusal of something.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's repudiation of the accusations did not convince the jury.
meanings.sent2: Her repudiation of the offer surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's repudiation of the new food was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The repudiation of reality in his story was intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The repudiation of responsibility led to serious consequences.

meanings.definition: The act of refusing to accept or acknowledge something.
meanings.sent1: The student's repudiation of the facts was concerning.
meanings.sent2: The government's repudiation of the report raised suspicions.
meanings.sent3: The repudiation of the truth in his argument was obvious.
meanings.sent4: Her repudiation of the evidence was unconvincing.
meanings.sent5: The repudiation of his authority caused chaos in the organization.
